acm.graphics

Class GLabel

  • java.lang.Object
    • acm.graphics.GObject
      • acm.graphics.GLabel
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    GScalable, Serializable, Cloneable

    public class GLabel
extends GObject
    The GLabel class is a graphical object whose appearance consists of a text string.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static Font DEFAULT_FONT
      The default font used to display strings.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      GLabel(String str)
      Creates a new GLabel object initialized to contain the specified string.
      GLabel(String str, double x, double y)
      Creates a new GLabel object with its baseline origin at the specified position.

    • Field Detail

      • DEFAULT_FONT

        public static final Font DEFAULT_FONT
        The default font used to display strings. You can change the font by invoking the setFont method.

    • Constructor Detail

      • GLabel

        public GLabel(String str)
        Creates a new GLabel object initialized to contain the specified string.
        Parameters:
        str - The initial contents of the GLabel
        Usage:
        GLabel glabel = new GLabel(str);

      • GLabel

        public GLabel(String str,
              double x,
              double y)
        Creates a new GLabel object with its baseline origin at the specified position.
        Parameters:
        str - The initial contents of the GLabel
        x - The x-coordinate of the label origin
        y - The y-coordinate of the baseline for the label
        Usage:
        GLabel glabel = new GLabel(str, x, y);

        Usage:

      • setBottomY

        public void setBottomY(double bottomY)
        Sets the bottom y-coordinate of this object to the given y value. Since labels use y-positioning relative to their bottom, not the top, this is equivalent to calling setY().
        Overrides:
        setBottomY in class GObject
        Parameters:
        bottomY - The new bottom y-coordinate for the object
        Usage:
        gobj.setBottomY(y);

      • setCenterLocation

        public void setCenterLocation(double centerX,
                              double centerY)
        Sets the central x/y-coordinates of this object to the given x/y values.
        Overrides:
        setCenterLocation in class GObject
        Parameters:
        centerX - The new central x-coordinate for the object
        centerY - The new central y-coordinate for the object
        Usage:
        gobj.setCenterLocation(x, y);

      • setCenterY

        public void setCenterY(double centerY)
        Sets the central y-coordinate of this object to the given y value.
        Overrides:
        setCenterY in class GObject
        Parameters:
        centerY - The new central y-coordinate for the object
        Usage:
        gobj.setCenterY(y);

      • setFont

        public void setFont(Font font)
        Changes the font used to display the GLabel. This call will usually change the size of the displayed object and will therefore affect the result of calls to getSize and getBounds.
        Parameters:
        font - A Font object indicating the new font
        Usage:
        glabel.setFont(font);

      • setFont

        public void setFont(String str)
        Changes the font used to display the GLabel as specified by the string str, which is interpreted in the style of Font.decode. The usual format of the font string is 

        
      family-style-size
 
        
 
        where both style and size are optional.  If any of these
 parts are specified as an asterisk, the existing value is retained.
        Parameters:
        str - A String specifying the new font
        Usage:
        glabel.setFont(str);

      • setLabel

        public void setLabel(String str)
        Changes the string stored within the GLabel object, so that a new text string appears on the display. Equivalent to setText.
        Parameters:
        str - The new string to display
        Usage:
        glabel.setLabel(str);

      • setText

        public void setText(String str)
        Changes the string stored within the GLabel object, so that a new text string appears on the display. Equivalent to setLabel.
        Parameters:
        str - The new string to display
        Usage:
        glabel.setText(str);

      • setTopY

        public void setTopY(double topY)
        Sets the top y-coordinate of this object to the given y value. Since labels use y-positioning relative to their bottom, not the top, this is equivalent to calling setY() and shifting downward by the label's height.
        Parameters:
        bottomY - The new top y-coordinate for the object
        Usage:
        gobj.setBottomY(y);
